name: df-limc
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4
body: |- wceq(climc, cmpo(s0, s1, co(cc, cpm, cc), cc, cab(s2, wsbc(s3, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld), wcel(cmpt(s4, cun(cdm(cv(s0)), csn(cv(s1))), cif(cv(s2), cfv(cv(s0), cv(s4)), wceq(cv(s4), cv(s1)))), cfv(co(co(cv(s3), crest, cun(cdm(cv(s0)), csn(cv(s1)))), ccnp, cv(s3)), cv(s1)))))))
comment: Define the set of limits of a complex function at a point. Under normal circumstances, this will be a singleton or empty, depending on whether the limit exists. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Dec-2016.)
